001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.loss;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.utils.Floats;
005
006/**
007 * Binary Cross-Entropy (BCE) loss function.
008 * <p>
009 * This loss function is used for binary classification tasks
010 * where each output neuron predicts the probability of a binary label
011 * (0 or 1) using a {@code sigmoid} activation function.
012 * It computes the cross-entropy between the predicted probability
013 * and the target label.
014 * </p>
015 *
016 * <h3>Definition</h3>
017 * For a single output:
018 * <pre>
019 *     E = - [ y * log(a) + (1 - y) * log(1 - a) ]
020 * </pre>
021 * where:
022 * <ul>
023 *   <li>{@code y} is the true label in {0,1}</li>
024 *   <li>{@code a} is the predicted probability (sigmoid output)</li>
025 * </ul>
026 *
027 * <h3>Gradients</h3>
028 * The derivative of the BCE loss with respect to the output activation {@code a} is:
029 * <pre>
030 *     dE/da = -( y / a - (1 - y) / (1 - a) )
031 * </pre>
032 * When combined with the derivative of the sigmoid activation {@code f'(z) = a(1 - a)},
033 * this simplifies to the familiar error signal:
034 * <pre>
035 *     δ = a - y
036 * </pre>
037 *
038 * <h3>Usage</h3>
039 * <ul>
040 *   <li>Output layer: one sigmoid unit per target</li>
041 *   <li>Loss function: {@code BinaryCrossEntropy}</li>
042 *   <li>Training: use the error signals δ = a - y as the starting point for backpropagation</li>
043 * </ul>
044 *
045 * <h3>Numerical stability</h3>
046 * To avoid {@code log(0)} or division by zero, a small epsilon (e.g. 1e-7)
047 * should be added when clamping predicted probabilities {@code a} into (0,1).
048 */
049@Strategy(role = Strategy.Role.CONCRETE)
050public class BinaryCrossEntropy implements DimensionLossFunction {
051
052    /**
053     * {@inheritDoc}
054     */
055    @Override
056    public float calculateDimensionLoss(float estimated, float target) {
057        float a = clamp01(estimated); // the activated value = estimated = predicted
058        float y = target; // the target output value
059        // Binary cross-entropy for this output
060        return -(y * (float) Math.log(a + Floats.EPSILON)
061                + (1f - y) * (float) Math.log(1f - a + Floats.EPSILON));
062    }
063
064    /**
065     * {@inheritDoc}
066     */
067    public float determineGradient(float estimated, float target) {
068        float a = clamp01(estimated);
069        float y = target;
070        // dE/da for binary cross-entropy
071        float dE_da = -(y / (a + Floats.EPSILON) - (1f - y) / (1f - a + Floats.EPSILON));
072        return dE_da;
073    }
074
075    private static float clamp01(float f) {
076        if (f < Floats.EPSILON) return Floats.EPSILON;
077        if (f > 1f - Floats.EPSILON) return 1f - Floats.EPSILON;
078        return f;
079    }
080
081}
